e4fb2b6b-fd3e-4ad4-9129-b022c12e7236.description: Recipients of this badge are able to create cohesive, coherent, and succinct memos.
e4fb2b6b-fd3e-4ad4-9129-b022c12e7236.name: International Career-Ready: One Page Memo

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Attend a memo writing workshop.
Element #2: Identify key information in an assigned case.
Element #3: Demonstrate impeccable writing skills using precise grammar form and structure.
Element #4: Effectively summarize an assigned case including key findings and recommendations.

970841c4-8df9-45b3-8fad-4b96eb0a8a0e.description: Recipients of the badge have the skills and knowledge required to prepare tenders for catering contracts. This skill is undertaken by senior operating personnel, marketing coordinators, supervisors or managers within catering or restaurant operations.
970841c4-8df9-45b3-8fad-4b96eb0a8a0e.name: Preparing Banquets and Catering Function Documents and Contracts Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Details for inclusion in documents needed in catering and banquets. Demonstrate ability to prepare a document for a specific commercial catering contract including assessment of the brief, coordination of details, accurate and profitable costing and professional presentation.
Element #2: Demonstrate knowledge of typical requirements and formats for banquets and catering documents.

6f3f0460-c677-4262-a06f-7d922f24abd8.description: Recipients of the badge are able to complete the business model canvas for a fictional or real venture. In order to obtain the badge, the user must be able to properly fill out the business model canvas template for a given venture in an exam setting. Relevant facts and context about the venture will be presented in a short case provided to the student. The completed canvas should provide a comprehensive view of the firm's business model.
6f3f0460-c677-4262-a06f-7d922f24abd8.name: Entrepreneurship: The Business Model Canvas

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1. Key Partners. Identify key partners required to deliver the business' value proposition to the customer and to realize its vision
Element #2. Key Activities. Discuss the key tasks the business will perform, either in-house or via third party, to deliver the product or service to the customer
Element #3. Value Propositions. Describe how the company's product or service will address customer needs in a differentiated way vs. the competition
Element #4. Key Resources. Indicate the significant physical, financial, intellectual or human resources required for the business to satisfy customer requirements and generate revenues
Element #5. Customer Segments. Identify the appropriate customer segments for the firm's product or service, and describe their usage and purchase behavior
Element #6. Customer Relationships. Define how the business will establish and sustain a relationship with its target customer segments given a revenue uplift objective
Element #7. Channels. Identify the different sales mediums where a customer can avail of the business' product or service
Element #8. Cost Structure. Discuss significant variable and fixed costs based on an understanding of the firm's key activities, resources and partnerships
Element #9. Revenue Structure. Identify the different sources of revenue for the business

db15a290-5c36-47c2-8f9e-96ff04d0b898.description: Recipients of this badge are able to effectively answer interview questions with accuracy, confidence, and poise in order to nail the desired position.
db15a290-5c36-47c2-8f9e-96ff04d0b898.name: International Career-Ready: Interview Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Attend an interview skills workshop.
Element #2: Research career fields and occupations of interest.
Element #3: Familiarize themselves with the common interview questions.
Element #4: Assess personal strengths and weaknesses.
Element #5: Demonstrate job interview skills by undergoing a mock interview with a professional.

92a8f63a-7a0b-4222-92f8-5eb8a31dfd93.description: The owner of this badge can develop a comprehensive marketing mix inclusive of product, pricing, channel and promotional strategy for new product or service launch that is aligned with the intended positioning and is appropriate for the target market.
92a8f63a-7a0b-4222-92f8-5eb8a31dfd93.name: Marketing: The Marketing Mix

badge_template_activities.title: PRODUCT STRATEGY: Describe product/service features and packaging (as applicable), backed up by insights on the preferences of the target market. Summarize core brand philosophy and attributes.
PRICING STRATEGY: Defend the suggested price for the product by citing pricing strategies, benchmark data and estimates used

PROMOTION STRATEGY: Develop an integrated marketing campaign for the first three years of the product or service's life — specify themes, objectives, campaigns and costs. Present draft/mock collateral from the integrated marketing campaign
CHANNEL STRATEGY: For a Product: Create a realistic distribution model for the product.  For a Service: Identify the intended location for the service and discuss the servicescape

3efd6e97-8a35-49a3-ac4c-c9b644c99144.description: Recipients of this badge are able to cover all basic hygiene requirements for food handlers in catering, and thoroughly addresses the Flow of Food from purchasing to serving.
3efd6e97-8a35-49a3-ac4c-c9b644c99144.name: FoodShap: Basic Food Handler Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Written Examination. Closed book multiple-choice written assessment of the standard operating procedures and basic hygiene requirements for food handlers.
Element #2: Practical-Virtual Kitchen Inspection Assessment. A practical examination of the application of Food Safety Laws and HACCP.

8ea38c3d-2256-468c-ae9a-56f21d212009.description: Recipients of this badge are able to properly plan, execute and manage events of any kind. In order to obtain this badge, the user must create bid proposals, marketing collaterals, an event evaluation tool, and conduct a risk management assessment needed in event planning.
8ea38c3d-2256-468c-ae9a-56f21d212009.name: Event Management Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Bid Proposal. Create a bid proposal that contains an overall design of an event.
Element #2: Marketing Collaterals. Prepare marketing collaterals that are appropriate for promoting an event to capture the right target audience.
Element #3: Risk Management Case Study Analysis. Create a risk assessment to identify possible pitfalls and prepare corresponding contingency plans.
Element #4: Event Evaluation Tool. Create a tool that sets the criteria for evaluating the successful and unsuccessful aspects of an event based on its objectives.

Element #5: Event Research. Produce a research paper on any of the following topics in relation to Events Management: Sustainability, Technology, MICE Tourism, Risk Management, Attendee Behavior and Attitudes.
Element #6: Event Design Project or Research. Demonstrate oral presentation and communication skills by creating a 3-minute video showcasing the project or research output.

fad21311-c124-47e5-ac8e-61b8ed520961.description: Recipients of this badge are able to demonstrate formal letter writing skills by writing a cover letter. The said letter was assessed based on content, diction, articulation, organization, and flow of ideas, writing conventions, format, and appearance.
fad21311-c124-47e5-ac8e-61b8ed520961.name: International Career-Ready: Memo Writing Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1. Communication Intent and Letter Content. The letter must clearly state the purpose with a strong impact on the reader. It must contain appropriate explanations and concrete facts to effectively support and put emphasis on the main idea/proposal. The tone should be appropriate for creating a strong impact on the intended audience.
Element #2. Choice of Words and Articulation. The word choice of the letter should be simple and relatable, and appropriate enough to create an impact on the audience.

Element #3. Organization and Flow of Ideas. The paragraphs should be cohesive and should use an excellent connection of words. The flow of thought should be excellently organized with clear and timely divisions.
Element #4 Conventions of Standards. The grammar should have no recognizable error and excellent use of capitalization, spelling, and punctuation marks should be observed.
Element #5 Format and Appearance. The letter should be typed using correct spacing, font, and format.

36cf012d-0984-4ca7-a1fa-4d47b849bf60.description: Recipients of this badge are able to create winning resumes that will aid in landing that dream job.
36cf012d-0984-4ca7-a1fa-4d47b849bf60.name: International Career-Ready Resume Writing Skills

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Attend a resume writing workshop.
Element #2: Examine a job advertisement and identify the key qualifications required.
Element #3: Construct a summary of qualifications.
Element #4: Create a comprehensive resume with accuracy, precision, and impact.

8a6b6a48-2866-4169-8ca0-c5f966f47767.description: Recipients of this badge have been introduced to the basic skills involved in becoming a cook and assisting in or with a professional kitchen team. The individual will possess basic knife skills for vegetable cuts, poultry, fish and beef fabrication. The individual also possesses culinary knowledge on these products.
8a6b6a48-2866-4169-8ca0-c5f966f47767.name: Kitchen Assistant

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Food Guide. Identify quality signs and parts of vegetables, poultry, fish and beef.
Element #2: Vegetables. Execute julienne, batonette, macedoine, bruniose, tourner, potato sticks, potato cubes, en palette, turned potatoes, lozenge, and cuts for onion and garlic.
Element #3: Poultry. Demonstrate proper cleaning, dressing, trussing for chicken and successfully cut the chicken into 8 pieces.

Element #4: Fish. Demonstrate dressing and preparation techniques for each aquatic product. The individual must also perform certain cleaning, fabricating and cooking skills on different types of fish.

Element #5: Food Safety and Sanitation. Demonstrate the principles of food safety and sanitation as particular to vegetables, poultry, fish and beef. Display proper uniform and grooming with compliance to sanitation and hygiene requirements, avoid cross-contamination, and demonstrate proper use of gloves, cleaning and sanitizing.

22967760-cfc4-470d-8843-d0763f262bc6.description: Recipients of the badge are able to conduct more systematic-approach to issues and concerns encountered in the workplace. Given a certain situation, the recipients of the badge will be able to decipher root causes and the needed data requirements in analyzing an operational issue at hand. Both from manufacturing and service perspectives, students will be able to employ the 7 Quality Control tools appropriately, according to the needs of the problem.
22967760-cfc4-470d-8843-d0763f262bc6.name: Seven Basic Quality Tools

badge_template_activities.title: Company Assessment.  The student should be able to do a basic SWOT and PEST Analysis of a company.

Systems-Approach to Analysis. The student should have an appreciation of systems-approach in Operations.  With this at hand, the student should be able to define the problem and decipher the root causes of operational concern.

Real-life Application. Choose a company and assess the context of the company using the SWOT or PEST Analysis. Gather data on the issue at hand. Apply the appropriate Quality Control tools for the analysis. Do a root cause analysis and suggest possible areas of intervention.

8a32e639-09bb-45e7-a0c8-3870d3d7b3e7.description: Recipients of this badge are able to utilize Opera PMS modules and their features to effectively and efficiently perform the required tasks or set of responsibilities expected of them by management. Recipients of the badge are also knowledgeable in performing operation audits of their hotel, resort, or any form of accommodation on a daily basis.
8a32e639-09bb-45e7-a0c8-3870d3d7b3e7.name: Front Office Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Accurately create all Profile Types utilizing the platform’s features;
Element #2: Create Reservations utilizing the platform’s features;
Element #3: Utilize the Front Desk module and all its features.
Element #4: Accurately perform Cashiering functions;
Element #5: Utilize Rooms Management module and all its features;
Element #6: Handle group bookings utilizing Business Blocks for Groups and all its features;
Element #7: Perform an End of Day Audit.

30c1cac8-cbe2-4a6c-89b9-098b8c0347d5.description: Recipients of this badge are able to demonstrate the ability to prepare for a sales call by understanding a product/service’s features, advantages over competition & the benefits that will accrue to a particular customer or qualified prospect; their knowledge of the company policies & procedures as part of the total offer; their knowledge of the industry so as to provide context to the dialogue with the customer; and their grasp of the customer needs that could be solved by the product/service.
30c1cac8-cbe2-4a6c-89b9-098b8c0347d5.name: Professional Salesmanship: Preparation and Prospecting

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Select an existing product or service that you would like to sell i.e. a car, a catering service, cellphone, insurance policy etc., describe the product/service features, and explain how these features help satisfy a need or solve a problem for the customer.

Element #2: Compare your product/service to the competition. Describe the advantages of your product and how is it different compared to your competitor’s product. Pick the top brand that competes with your product/service.

Element #3: Describe your target market segment: Identify their locations, sizes, etc, enumerate your assumptions about their needs/problems, describe their purchase behavior, describe how often they buy, and describe how they rank the features and benefits associated with your product/service.

Element #4: List down your capabilities as a salesman that will be needed to support the sale i.e. experience (length of time in business), size of operations as well as list down your policies and procedures such as processing procedures, credit policies, transportation charges, promotions, discounts, and allowances, etc.

Element #5: Analyze the changes and trends in your industry and its impact on the business. Compare your strengths and weaknesses and make a SWOT analysis. Consider the following factors: Regulatory or Legal Constraints, Technology, Customer Tastes, Attitudes and Segments, Economic Conditions, and Expectations.

Element #6: Identify the one potential customer and the company you will be calling on and list as much information you can get about the prospect from newspaper accounts, LinkedIn, Google, social media etc.
Element #7: Make a list of the interview questions you will ask the person you will be visiting.

37966fe3-e257-40a4-84b8-da336aeb5968.description: Recipients of this badge possess the skills in financial administration and risk management. They are able to forecast risks; conceptualize, implement, monitor, and evaluate the prospective risks in an event; as well as manage effectively the site infrastructure and logistics plan. They also understand the concepts of designing security and emergency response plan.
37966fe3-e257-40a4-84b8-da336aeb5968.name: Risk Management, Financial Administration, and Site Management

badge_template_activities.title: Create and present an original MICE event featuring a safety and security plan, a contingency plan, budgeting, funding, management of sales process, logistics, and communication plan.

ad8f4494-484f-4d1e-a0eb-0450c25b4c68.description: Recipients of this badge are able to perform the following: Construct efficient and appropriate representation of a given set of data using corresponding data visualization techniques; Generalize the characteristics of a given set of data using measures of central tendency, measures of dispersion, and measures of position; and Formulate insights about a given set of data using descriptive statistics.
ad8f4494-484f-4d1e-a0eb-0450c25b4c68.name: Descriptive Statistics

badge_template_activities.title: Data Organization and Presentation: Use appropriate data visualization technique/s to efficiently represent a given set of data.
Data Treatment: Compute for the relevant measures of central tendency, measures of dispersion, and measures of the position of the given set of data.
Data Analysis and Interpretation: Make a general description of the given set of data using its descriptive statistics.

4344f8bd-90ed-46db-8074-5f5d37dc3c4e.description: Recipients of this badge understand the identification, categorization, and management of stakeholders. They also possess the requirements in crafting the selection criteria for human resources and the best practices in managing teams.
4344f8bd-90ed-46db-8074-5f5d37dc3c4e.name: Stakeholder, Staff, and Volunteer Management

badge_template_activities.title: Create and present an original staff and volunteer manual template for MICE events based on the principles of human resource management discussed in this course from recruitment, selection, orientation, training, and supervision.

b8835006-c8f6-47a1-924a-0f0196d632de.description: Recipients of this badge understand the fundamentals of event design beginning with the process of identifying client needs and preferences, research design options and the design elements that match the event goals and objectives. They are exposed to the design phase of the event management process using internal and external team members.
b8835006-c8f6-47a1-924a-0f0196d632de.name: Event Design

badge_template_activities.title: Create and present an original MICE event by determining the various requirements such as program content and formats, food and beverage, performers, signages, technical specifications, and others, and developing the appropriate designs for different event elements.

995482a6-6b53-4c06-a6d4-8e7588018b5e.description: Recipients of this badge are able to properly plan, execute and manage events of any kind. In order to obtain this badge, the user must create bid proposals, marketing collaterals, an event evaluation tool, and conduct a risk management assessment needed in event planning.
995482a6-6b53-4c06-a6d4-8e7588018b5e.name: Event Management Associate

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Bid Proposal. Create a bid proposal that contains an overall design of an event.
Element #2: Marketing Collaterals. Prepare marketing collaterals that are appropriate for promoting an event to capture the right target audience.
Element #3: Risk Management Case Study Analysis. Create a risk assessment to identify possible pitfalls and prepare corresponding contingency plans.
Element #4: Event Evaluation Tool. Create a tool that sets the criteria for evaluating the successful and unsuccessful aspects of an event based on its objectives.

Element #5: Event Research. Produce a research paper on any of the following topics in relation to Events Management: Sustainability, Technology, MICE Tourism, Risk Management, Attendee Behavior and Attitudes.
Element #6: Event Design Project or Research. Demonstrate oral presentation and communication skills by creating a 3-minute video showcasing the project or research output.
Element #7: Grade Requirement. Must receive a grade of 90% or more on all required criteria.

c83ae557-9178-4241-8b6e-94609f314cac.description: Recipients of this badge are able to successfully manage events, determine marketing strategies that are essential to successful selling, and compare promotional methods and their effectiveness for a specific target audience. They are able to create a comprehensive marketing and sponsorship plan.
c83ae557-9178-4241-8b6e-94609f314cac.name: Event Marketing

badge_template_activities.title: Create and present a comprehensive marketing and sponsorship plan for an original MICE event by using the different principles and strategies of event marketing and highlighting marketing materials, event merchandise, sales activities, and media and public relations activities.

23776119-3790-4cc3-8ad1-da29b0be418c.description: Recipients of this badge are able to: Set project objectives which are S.M.A.R.T. and linked to an organization’s strategies; define the scope of a project; create a Work Breakdown Structure to the work package level; perform a Critical Path Analysis; level resources used in a project; perform a risk assessment and identify appropriate risk responses; layout the Budgeted Cost of Work Scheduled (BCWS); put together a Project Plan covering the elements listed above.
23776119-3790-4cc3-8ad1-da29b0be418c.name: Project Management

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Demonstrate the ability to produce the deliverables of the activities stated above.
Element #2: Deliver a Project Plan containing the elements listed in the “Description” and meeting standards worthy of an executive presentation.

9a765014-92f5-4a73-abf5-3493beacbcda.description: Recipients of this badge should demonstrate their understanding of concepts in Warehouse and Distribution Management. The paradigm of the topic is covered by the determination of the efficiency, effective utilization, cost implications, and the working environment of the warehouse and distribution facilities, mapped out in a bigger scale and scope of Supply Chain Management. These metrics are measurable and are evaluated through the recipient's ability to examine the given case study.
9a765014-92f5-4a73-abf5-3493beacbcda.name: Warehousing and Distribution Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Element 1.1 Warehousing Essentials: Inventory Control. Demonstrate the essentials of managing inventory in a storage facility, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

Element 1.2 Warehousing Essentials: Inventory Digital Infrastructure and Info-Systems. Demonstrate the applicable digital infrastructure for a storage facility to manage properly its inventory, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

Element 1.3 Warehousing Essentials: Warehouse Receiving. Demonstrate the techniques of receiving and validating the inventory items, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

Element 1.4 Warehousing Essentials: Putaway and Release. Demonstrate the techniques of storage, picking, dispensing, and release of inventory items, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.
Element 2.1 Distribution Essentials: Distribution Channels. Demonstrate the essentials of distribution channels, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

Element 2.2 Distribution Essentials: Logistics and Transport. Demonstrate the concepts, techniques, and schedule of logistics and transport, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

Element 2.3 Distribution Essentials: Distribution Management. Demonstrate how the company responds to the distribution of its finished goods in order to cope with customer demand, and explain its impact on the overall supply chain strategy of the firm.

f934e54b-6a20-478c-ae38-abbff2632e16.description: Recipients of this badge are able to create and present a strategic and sustainable plan for M.I.C.E. They understand the Event Management Body of Knowledge, the Project Management Body of Knowledge, the steps in strategic planning, event principles, policies, procedures, event operation, and standards in professional event management. They also possess key elements in the business of Meetings, Incentives, Conferences and Conventions, Exhibitions, and Events.
f934e54b-6a20-478c-ae38-abbff2632e16.name: Strategic Planning

badge_template_activities.title: Create and present an original strategic and sustainable plan for a MICE event using the principles of the Event Management Body of Knowledge and the Project Management Body of Knowledge.

478ee14a-9fb9-4776-a579-8b26b380c9bb.description: This badge is awarded to those who have completed the 5 courses under the MICE Professional Events Management Certificate Program (Strategic Planning, Event Design, Stakeholder, Staff, and Volunteer Management, Event Marketing, and Risk Management, Financial Administration, and Site Management).
478ee14a-9fb9-4776-a579-8b26b380c9bb.name: PhilMICE Certified

badge_template_activities.title: Strategic Planning
Event Design
Stakeholder, Staff, and Volunteer Management
Event Marketing
Risk Management, Financial Administration, and Site Management

cd213842-93d2-4ddd-9f4d-c663d3dc1ce2.description: Recipients of this badge can understand, communicate and express himself/herself in spoken and written Spanish, using a simple language in daily situations and cultural aspects.
cd213842-93d2-4ddd-9f4d-c663d3dc1ce2.name: Spanish Breakthrough Level

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Oral. Within 5 minutes, the student talks about himself/herself in terms of professions and hobbies; gives detailed descriptions about cities; can go to the market and order food in a restaurant; can ask people for and give the time, and talk about schedules and frequency of activities/habits.
Element #2: Written. The student writes about a city with regards to its location, tourist attractions, typical food, and habitual activities within the place.

4ebc3775-44dc-411d-91b1-c0b82a1f0a53.description: Recipients of this badge are able to articulate, communicate, and serve as advocates for the important socio-environmental issues of our time. They are expected to champion sustainable solutions and policy changes for a better world.
4ebc3775-44dc-411d-91b1-c0b82a1f0a53.name: Sustainability Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Final grade of 80% or higher in the subject, Policy and Governance for Sustainability.

Element #2: An online publication of a 1000-word article on the Medium platform about any subject related to public policy or corporate governance for sustainability; the article must reach a combined 100 likes and shares.
Element #3: Complete 20 hours of community service that is approved by the instructor, and should be completed prior to the end of the semester.

e26f18a5-8287-4c59-8ee6-c9c692644bac.description: Recipients of this badge are expected to know basic French and use of pronouns, conjugation of verbs, basic grammatical rules. He/She is able to read and understand simple sentences.
e26f18a5-8287-4c59-8ee6-c9c692644bac.name: French Breakthrough Level

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Oral. The student shall give a five-minute uninterrupted description of the various ways of ordering food or looking for an apartment in Paris. The student should provide clear explanations using simple words and sentence construction.
Element #2: Orthography and Grammar. The student shall listen to and respond to a dictée of about 150 words given by Assessor.
Element #3: Written. The student shall write a one-page essay showing ways to purchase a train ticket or an airline ticket over the counter OR online.

a7243425-0675-4fb6-b2d4-f1f8e62bca3b.description: Recipients of this badge are capable of constructing and understanding sentences and engaging in simple conversations on specific topics.
a7243425-0675-4fb6-b2d4-f1f8e62bca3b.name: Mandarin Breakthrough Level

badge_template_activities.title: Element #1: Oral. The student shall give a five-minute uninterrupted description about dealing with sickness, shopping, buying, bargaining and giving directions on where and how to go to shopping places and restaurants, ordering food.
Element #2: Written. The student shall write a one-page essay describing common Chinese food delights, their history and the different ways they are served.
